you can remove the gnome keyboard settings by themselves. i can get you the command in a minute here.
you could also see if it works in the "failsafe xterm" session.
in gdm you select "sessions" on the login screen and select "failsafe xterm", or something similar.
to reset just gnome's keyboard settings: gconftool --recursive-unset /desktop/gnome/peripherals/keyboard
that's interesting, because it means X is probabbly configured right, but gnome is doing something silly. try the above command (ideally at the text console while logged out)
